channel.title: [ Important ] Levels Past 99?
channel.description: Okay well I'm starting a pretty big server with a flawless dodian source I've been working on for quite some time. I plan to release the server to the community, but first I want to make the possible max skill levels past 99. For example the max strength level you can reach is 99, I want to make the max strength level, etc. atleast 150. Is there any possible way to do this server sided on a dodian source?

item.title: [ Important ] Levels Past 99?
item.dc:creator: @matthy matthy
item.description:
@matthy wrote:

well im followed a tutorial but i was need to change the file that send frames to client so i thought its frames.java
and i added:

public void setSkillLvl(Player user, int lvlId) { if (user == null || user.stream == null || user.disconnected[0]) { return; } user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.createFrame(217); user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.writeByteC(user.skillLvl[lvlId]); user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.writeDWord_v2(user.skillXP[lvlId]); user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.writeByteC(lvlId); }
but i get that errors then:

.\Bulby\.\io\Frames.java:775: cannot find symbol symbol : method getNetwork() location: class Bulby.players.Player user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.createFrame(217); ^ .\Bulby\.\io\Frames.java:776: cannot find symbol symbol : method getNetwork() location: class Bulby.players.Player user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.writeByteC(user.skillLvl [lvlId]); ^ .\Bulby\.\io\Frames.java:777: cannot find symbol symbol : method getNetwork() location: class Bulby.players.Player user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.writeDWord_v2(user.skill XP[lvlId]); ^ .\Bulby\.\io\Frames.java:778: cannot find symbol symbol : method getNetwork() location: class Bulby.players.Player user.getNetwork().parseFrameForSending().stream.writeByteC(lvlId);
this is for 508*************

Read full topic

Create your own method imo.

as for the client (taking more time) you will need to look for how the skills are displayed.

item.title: [ Important ] Levels Past 99?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

That part right there is the part that was limiting you to 99

[code=java]
public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;
for (int lvl = 1; lvl < 136; lvl++) {
points += Math.floor(
(double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
if ((output - 1) >= exp) {
return lvl;
}
}

return 150;
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.description:

Edit: Also what about this part?

if (exp > 13034430) return 99;

Read full topic

item.title: [ Important ] Levels Past 99?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[code=java]
public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;
for (int lvl = 1; lvl < 150; lvl++) {
points += Math.floor(
(double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
if ((output - 1) >= exp) {
return lvl;
}
}

return 150;
}[/code]

However, I’m pretty sure the highest skill a player can reach is ~135, due to the 200m exp limit.

Read full topic

item.title: [ Important ] Levels Past 99?
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

[code] }

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;
	if (exp > 13034430)
		return 99;
	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0
				* Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 0;
}

[/code]

I just found this coding, so for example if I doubled the return 99 to 198, would I also double the XP amount?

Read full topic
